newsitem.title: UK: UK firms yet to suffer from pound's strength.
newsitem.headline: UK firms yet to suffer from pound's strength.

text.p: Andrew Buxton, chairman of the Confederation of British Industry's Economic Affairs Committee, said on Tuesday that UK exporters had yet to suffer from the pound's recent strength.
"At present levels industry is not worried about the recent stength of the pound," he told reporters.
"There will obviously come a point where they would worry but I don't know what that is."
The CBI's chief economist Kate Barker noted that the October Industrial Trends survey took the pound as standing at 2.38 marks compared with 2.37 marks in July.
The pound was trading at 2.4475/80 marks in midday trade on Tuesday.
The pound has appreciated by over 5.0 percent on a trade weighted basis since early August.
